fields.description:
The *Confluence HipChat plugin* exposed the secret key it used to communicate with a linked HipChat service in various pages. For this vulnerability to affect your Confluence instance you must have a HipChat integration established. To exploit this issue, attackers need to have access to a Confluence account that has either:
 * Create space permission (this is a default permission for all users)
 * Space admin permission for any space
 * Confluence Administrator or System Administrator permission

Using the secret key attackers can gain full control over a linked HipChat instance.

\\
*Affected versions:*
 * All versions of *Confluence HipChat plugin* from 6.26.0 before *7.8.17* are affected by this vulnerability. 
 * All versions of *Confluence* from 5.9.1 before *5.9.14* (the fixed version for 5.9.x) and from 5.10.0 before *5.10.4* (the fixed version for 5.10.x) are affected by this vulnerability.

 

*Fix:*
 * The *Confluence HipChat plugin* can be updated through Confluence's add-on manager. For instructions on how to update the Confluence HipChat plugin see [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Updating+add-ons].
 * *Confluence Server* 5.10.4 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download].
 * *Confluence Server* 5.9.14 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives].

 

*Risk Mitigation:*
 * If you are unable to upgrade your Confluence server or the Confluence HipChat plugin, then as a *temporary workaround*, you can disable or uninstall the *Confluence HipChat plugin and the Atlassian HipChat Integration plugin* in Confluence.

 

 For additional details see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/yIGbMg].
fields.summary: CVE-2016-6668 - The HipChat plugin for various products leaks the secret key it uses to communicate with a linked HipChat instance.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43671].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
By default, the _Show Changed Content_ functionality is enabled to all users as described in the product documentation: [Email Notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/email-notifications-145162.html].

This functionality may overload the Confluence server and/or the email infrastructure if many changes in pages occur at the same time.

Currently, there's no way for the Confluence administrator to disable this functionality to all users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make it possible to disable/enable this feature site-wide or to make it disabled by default to new users.


h3. Workaround
The following KB describes a workaround to disable this functionality to all existing users in the database.
[How to disable Show Changed Content to all users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-disable-show-changed-content-to-all-users-407725054.html]
fields.summary: As a Confluence administrator I would like to disable the 'Show Changed Content' to all users

h3. Summary
Confluence e-mail notifications are not displayed properly in Apple Mail:
* Some icons are shown bigger than they should, and others are shown smaller than they should. 
* The Recommended Updates e-mail notification contains text that overlaps the user's picture.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.10.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# With e-mail notifications on, have another user attach a file to a page that you are watching in Confluence.
# With Recommended Updates feature on, wait for an e-mail with updates.

h3. Expected Results
The e-mail notifications are expected to look like what is shown in the following screenshots (regardless of the mail client used):
 !recommended_in_confluence-gmail_OK.png|thumbnail! 
 !expected_attachment_notification.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Apple mail shows icons with wrong size, as well as overlapping text in Recommended updates e-mail, as show in the screenshots below:
 !recommended_in_confluence-apple_mail_NOK.png|thumbnail! 
 !wrong_icon_sizes-apple_mail.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This issue is similar to Jira's https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-46028

It seems that the original icon sizes are 32x32 based on firefox inspection of the e-mail (see screenshots below). This size is altered through html img, but this does not seem to work properly in Apple Mail:
 !inspection_page_icon.png|thumbnail! 
!inspection_attachment_icon.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Use another e-mail client, such as gmail webmail.
fields.summary: Confluence e-mail notifications are not displayed properly in Apple Mail

fields.description:
This JVM parameter "confluence.cluster.index.recovery.generation.timeout" is used when index recovery is required in Confluence Data Center 5.9+ (for a technical description of this feature, see CONF-43391).

The default value for this parameter is 120 seconds if not explicitly set, meaning a CDC node will wait this long when asking another node to generate and send an index snapshot before giving up. For larger customers, this value is a bit low as the index snapshot often takes 3-5 minutes to generate. I would recommend to upwardly adjust this to 300 seconds (5 minutes) as a default.

The index recovery feature is invoked on Confluence startup. The downside of a slightly longer (potentially) startup time is easily worth Confluence having a higher chance to recover an index from another node, thereby avoiding having to reindex on its own. This is especially true for the largest customers, whose instances require 6+ hours to fully rebuild an index.

In the mean time, larger customers running CDC 5.9+ can set this [startup parameter|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+System+Properties] to manually configure the timeout to be 300 seconds:
{code}
-Dconfluence.cluster.index.recovery.generation.timeout=300
{code}
fields.summary: Increase default value of "confluence.cluster.index.recovery.generation.timeout"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you use the "Find and Replace" feature on the page editor to search for a combination of unformatted and formatted text, it results in the following:
* If the words are not formatted, the words will be found and highlighted.
* If the words are all formatted, the words will be found and highlighted.
* If some of the words, but not all, are formatted, the words will not be found or highlighted.

For example, the search term is "big cat". Given the following format, these are the results:
||Format of search term on the page||Result||
|bad cat|All occurrences of the words are found and highlighted.|
|*bad cat*|All occurrences of the words are found and highlighted.|
|bad *cat*|Only the non-formatted occurrences are found and highlighted, right before it hits another formatted match.|

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page.
# Copy the content of  [^sampletext.rtf].
# Press CTRL+F / CMD+F to search for content within the page (while still in edit mode).
# Search for the words "love confluence".
# Press enter to traverse through the entire text for a complete word search.

h3. Expected Results
All occurrences of "love confluence" will be found.

h3. Actual Results
Only the first "love confluence" is highlighted and found. All other occurrences are ignored and not highlighted/found.

h3. Environment
||Browser||Result||
|Google Chrome Version 52.0.2743.116 (64-bit)|Can be replicated. (/)|
|Firefox 48.0.1|Can be replicated. (/)|
|Safari Version 9.1.1 (11601.6.17)|Can't be replicated. (x)|
|Internet Explorer 11|Can be replicated. Results in this bug to occur as well: [CONF-42641|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-42641] (/)|

h3. Issue Replication
Video can be found here: [^CONF-43614.mov]. Issue was replicated in Google Chrome.
fields.summary: 'Find' in page editor does not highlight formatted text

Regards
Ronald

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43599].
  {panel}

As an admin, there are some tasks that I need to be able to complete while the directory is not syncing. With a large directory, trying to squeeze a change between syncs can be an issue. The only two options I have at the moment are either: increase the sync interval to a massive number and hope I hit the right window or change the Crowd username/password that it's syncing against so it just doesn't work.

It would be great to have a UI option that just pauses syncing while checked.

The tasks this would help with are:
* Importing confluence spaces
* Restarting the service (first thing it does is run a sync)
* I'm sure there's more....


This would be useful in JIRA, BitBucket etc as well
fields.summary: Allow directory sync to be paused

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you add a ORDER BY clause on the JQL of a JIRA Issue/Filter, you won't be able to change the sort of the column through the UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project in *JIRA* with 5 tickets.
# Go to a Confluence page and insert a JIRA Issue Macro.
# On the *Search* field, add the following filter:
{code}
project = <project> order by Key  
{code}
(i) The *Key* field is default.
# Save the page.
# The JIRA Issue Macro is displaying all issues ordered by the *Key* column.
# Try to sort the *Key* field manually by clicking on it.

h3. Expected Results

The *Key* column will change the sort.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the UI:

{noformat}
JIRA project doesn't exist or you don't have permission to view it.
View these issues in JIRA
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
# Adding the filter:
 !filter.png|thumbnail! 
# After saving the filter:
 !Before_clicking_the_key_column.png|thumbnail! 
# Error after trying to sort the column mentioned in the ORDER BY:
 !after_clicking_on_Key_column.png|thumbnail! 

It looks that the ORDER BY locks the column.


h3.Workaround
Remove the *Order by* clause.
fields.summary: Can't sort column if the same one is being mentioned in a ORDER BY clause - JQL - Jira Issue Macro

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Previously, every time you edited a page but didn't save it, Confluence would create a draft of the page that was only visible to you – we call these personal drafts. Now that collaborative editing is here, Confluence creates a draft whenever anyone edits a page and doesn't publish their changes, and all page editors work on the same (shared) draft. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to view the unsaved drafts with collaborative editing.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43576].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

In case that Confluence is integrated with external directories, remember-me token should be ignored when users managed in the directories log in Confluence at least.
The root need is that users can still log in after an administrator forces a password change (due to the remember-me token).

h3. Environment
 * Confluence 5.10.4
 * Crowd 2.9.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate Confluence with Crowd
 # Log in Confluence with a user (User A) and then, check "Remember my login on this computer"
 # Restart the browser
 # Access Confluence with the same browser

h3. Expected Results

Confluence should show login page and need User A to input the credentials
h3. Actual Results

User A could log in without any authentication.
h3. Notes
 * The above actual results might cause some troubles in the following scenario{panel}_In case that there are some password leakages, an admin of the external directories wants the users to update their passwords immediately._
 # In the past, User A logged in Confluence with checking "Remember my login on this computer"
 # An admin of Crowd notices that a password of User A was leaked
 # The admin access Crowd, open user setting page of User A and set an attribute called "requiresPasswordChange" as "true" (It would require User A to update the password when the next login.)
 # In spite of the above setting, User A can log in Confluence without updating the password{panel}
* JIRA, Bitbucket Server and Bamboo behave as well at this moment

h3. Workaround

Disabling remember-me token is only the workaround.
fields.summary: When a password in an external directory is reset, Administrators should have an option to invalidate 'remember me' tokens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43573].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When clicking the Create Decision/Product requirements/Meeting notes button while using the Decision/Product Requirements/Meeting notes Blueprint, a duplicate Decision Log/Product requirements/Meeting notes page is created when submitting it. Removing the duplicate page then creating another decision, results in the duplicate page being created again. Leaving the duplicate page and creating another decision does not result in a third page being created.
h3. Environment

Cloud - 1000.260.0 / 1000.444.5
 Server - Current
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using the Decision blueprint as an example. Create a new space using the Decision Blueprint or open an existing space that is using this Blueprint
 # Click the Decision Log link in the sidebar menu
 # Click the 'Create decision' button
 # Fill in the required information
 # Submit the decision
 # Publish the decision

h3. Expected Results

The new decision should be added under the decision log parent page
h3. Actual Results

The new decision log is added under the decision log parent page however a duplicate Decision Log page is created and listed as 
 'Decision Log (2)'
h3. Notes

Confluence appears to want the new parent page to be the parent page that will be used
h3. Workaround

Moving the existing children to the new parent page, deleting the original parent, and then renaming the new parent page will allow a user to continue to create additional decisions without additional parent pages being created.
 Currently the only work around is to leave the duplicate page while decisions are being input
fields.summary: When using any blueprints from a Software space a duplicate page using the same blueprint is created

fields.description:
h3. Summary

MP4 files do not play in Safari
h3. Environment
 * Safari
 * El Capitan / Yosemite

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Download the [^small.mp4] file attached to this ticket
 # Drag and drop the file to a Confluence page
 # View the page in Safari

h3. Expected Results

Video autoplays and can be viewed/controlled
h3. Actual Results

No video is displayed, but you get a *Quicktime ?* icon in the page
h3. Notes

We've tried following the workaround in the following page to ensure that the Quicktime plugin is enabled (in El Capitan it is disabled by default): [https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT205081]

From the article above:
{quote}
If you're a web developer, update your webpages to replace any <embed> tags that call the legacy QuickTime 7 web plug-in. You should now use the HTML5 <video> tag, which allows your media to play back in most modern desktop and mobile web browsers, without additional software or plug-ins. Information about how to use this tag is widely available.
{quote}
We would need to change the plugin so that it embeds videos using the <video> tag on pages. This would help as modern browsers are able to play this natively without the use of plugins.
h3. Workarounds
 # Edit the HTML source and change the {{<embed></embed>}} tags surrounding the video URL to {{<video></video>}} tags.
 # Use the HTML macro to display the video from a URL:
{code:java}
<video width="700" height="500" controls>
  <source src="<video URL>">
</video>

{code}
fields.summary: MP4 files do not play in Safari using the multimedia macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The *Live Search Macro* can't search pages/spaces with an underscore on its name. You need to add a wildcard ( * ), or the macro will not search for the content. This doesn't happen on the "Global Search". Apparently, the Live Search macro is not understanding the underscore character, so the wildcard is probably ignoring it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page with title: "Test_Live"
 # In another page, insert the *Live Search Macro*.
 # Type "Test" on the field.
 # No results will be found.
 # Now type "Test*" - (i) The {{*}} is a wildcard of the Lucene Library.
 # The page will be found.

h3. Expected Results

You would not need to insert a wildcard to search content with an underscore
h3. Actual Results

You need to add a wildcard or the macro will not find anything with an underscore.
h3. Workaround

No workarounds if you need to use the Live Search Macro, but if you don't, you can use the Global Search instead.
fields.summary: Live search macro can't search properly documents with underscore(_)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43561].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Epic Link column in "Insert JIRA Issue/Filter" (a table inserted in a Confluence page) does not have an hyperlink to the corresponding Epic. Additionally, this field in Confluence does not show the name of the Epic (as Jira's equivalent column does), and does not color-code the Epic link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Pre-requisites:
 * Confluence and Jira have an Application Link established and working
 * In Jira there is at least one existing issue (FLP-7, bug1) which is linked to an Epic (e.g. FLP-2 with Epic name "CSP-183740 test") in the same project (FLP)

Steps:
 # Create a new page in Confluence and write a title
 # Insert "JIRA Issue/Filter"
 # Write a filter to grab all the issues from project FLP
 # Open the "Display Options" and edit the columns to be show to be
 ** Key
 ** Summary
 ** Epic Link
 ** Epic Name
 # Click "Insert" and save the Confluence Page... 

Now navigate to Jira and search for issues:
 # Issues > Search For Issues > write a filter for 'project = "FLP"'
 # Configure the Columns of this query to show:
 ** Key
 ** Summary
 ** Epic Link
 ** Epic Name
 # Now observe the generated table and compare it to the one created in Confluence through Jira filter macro.

h3. Expected Results

By comparing both tables, we observe that the columns in Confluence do not match the columns in Jira. There are several issues:
 # The epic link should be a link in Confluence
 # The epic link should also show the name of the Epic, to conform to what is seen in Jira
 # The epic link should also be color coded, as in Jira.

h3. Actual Results
 # The Epic Link is *not a link* in Confluence. The field name implies that it should be a link to the Epic.
 # The Epic Link in Jira shows the Epic name, while in Confluence it shows the Key of the corresponding issue
 # The Epic Link in Confluence is not color coded as it is in Jira.

The screenshot below shows the difference between the same filter configured in Jira and Confluence:
 !epic-link_jira_filter_vs_confluence_macro.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The issue is not always reproducible, on several cases it happens intermittently.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround. The users have to manually lookup for the issue key corresponding to the Epic they are looking for. There is no known way to display the information as neatly as it is in Jira.
fields.summary: Epic Link column in Confluence's "Insert JIRA Issue/Filter" is not displayed properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Middle mouse button paste on Linux does not paste the specified copied string. This issue happens when a page contains tables. Should there are any modifications to Confluence page content that happens between copying action and pasting action, the clipboard will change to the newly modified content

h3. Environment
* Linux
* Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page
# Have a string "test". Block with mouse and copy using Ctrl+C
# Create a new 3x3 table
# Paste the string using middle click in any cell. This is alright
# Modify the table by adding a row/column
# Paste the string again using middle click in any cell

h3. Expected Results
The string  "test" will be copied to the correct cell

h3. Actual Results
The copied content will be the content of the whole page *after* modifying the table (step 5 above)
 
h3. Notes
* See the video [^clipboard.ogv] for more clarifications
* It seems to copy anything from the cursor position up to the top of the table

h3.Workaround
Do not use middle click button for pasting
fields.summary: Middle mouse button paste on Linux will not paste specified copied string

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43558].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Confluence has the following Column width modes as per this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/confcloud/Tables]
* *Responsive* – The table will expand as you add content, and you can drag to resize the columns. It'll also resize itself to fit the page-viewer's window size (within reason).

* *Fixed width* – Drag column borders to set width. Columns appear at your set size, regardless of content and window size.

Table that you can drag to resize the columns can be Responsive

h3. Suggested Solution
* Table that you can resize the columns to fixed width should be _Fixed width_ not _Responsive_.
fields.summary: Responsive tables should not have a fixed width

h3. Problem

Our Confluence instance crashed today. It was traced back to an issue with the Code Macro rendering a particularly large code sample for more than 1 user concurrently.

I checked the Code Macro configuration and didn't see a way to add a line limit to prevent this in the future.

It will be easy to educate our users about this issue now, but if there's no way to prevent users from doing this again I fear that we'll end up in the same situation.

h3. Suggestion:
What I'm looking for is find a way to prevent a confluence crash in the future. We use the code macro a lot, and when users forget about this limitation, I don't want that to lead to our Confluence instance crashing.
fields.summary: Add limitation to Code Macro

fields.description:
Due to Confluence server/cloud fork, the Confluence build version is being maintained the same on versions 5.10.x.

Confluence _com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.web.conditions.BuildNumberCondition_ incorrectly reports the Confluence build version instead of the marketplace build number for plugin development and check.

That should be updated to use the com.atlassian.confluence.setup.BuildInformation#marketplaceBuildNumber instead.
fields.summary: Confluence provides incorrect build number for marketplace plugins

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The colour of the text highlight in the Application Navigator does not reflect the colour that has been set in the Colour Scheme settings.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(i) You must have an application link to be able to see the Application Navigator.

# Navigate to General Configuration >  Colour Scheme and edit the colour scheme.
# Change the following colours to any noticeable/striking colours to see effect:
#* Top Bar Menu Selected Background	
#* Menu Item Selected Background
# Save the changes.
# Click on the three bars icon in the top left corner of the page.
# Hover over any of the menu items.

h3. Expected Results
The colour of the text highlight should be the colour you changed it to in the Colour Scheme settings as "Menu Item Selected Background".

h3. Actual Results
The colour of the text highlight is the default blue colour.

*Note*: The colour is reflected properly if you hover over the menu items under Spaces, Confluence Administration, Help, and Profile.
fields.summary: Colour Scheme not applied to Application Navigator drop-down

h3. Summary
Adding fields *version* and *Affects Version/s* in JIRA issue macro under Display options are both displayed as *Affected Version/s*
h3. Environment
Confluence 5.8.5
JIRA 7.1.7
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence and JIRA application Link

h3. Actual Results
!Result.png|thumbnail!
*Display Options*
!Displayoption.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Version is displayed as Affected version in JIRA Issue/Filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence throws {{java.lang.IllegalStateException: ClobStringType requires active transaction synchronization}} in the log files.

This is often followed by the same error as logged in CONF-43246, however the steps to reproduce {{net.sf.hibernate.NonUniqueObjectException: a different object with the same identifier value was already associated with the session: 29261827, of class: com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Page}} in that ticket does not generate this error.
h3. Environment

Based on investigation of support tickets, I have seen this error in:
h4. Database
 * Microsoft SQL Server
 * MySQL
 * PostgreSQL
 * Oracle 12c

h4. Add-Ons

The only Add-ons in common for the customer issues were all default Confluence Add-Ons
 * atlassian-gadgets-shared-3.3.24.jar
 * com.springsource.net.jcip.annotations-1.0.0
 * crowd.system.passwordencoders
 * org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-jdbc-4.2.0.RELEASE_2
 * org.apache.servicemix.bundles.spring-tx-4.2.0.RELEASE_2
 * org.randombits.confluence.toc

h4. Bob Swift related error

This issue was logged with Bob Swift ([SQL-446|https://bobswift.atlassian.net/browse/SQL-446]) although the fix there was to remove RandomBits Add-Ons. As shown above, not all customers have this Add-On (except the for default toc), so this is likely a [red herring|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_herring].
h3. Steps to Reproduce
h4. Source code

Error comes from here, but it's unclear how it's caused.
{code:java|title=package com.atlassian.confluence.web.filter.ConfluenceOpenSessionInViewFilter#closeSession}
// We have to make sure that we throw NO exceptions from this method, or we just end up masking problems
// in the Spring session filter (the terrible ClobStringType requires active txn sync bug..), and we also
// interrupt the session cleanup and leak db connections. - cm
@Override
protected void closeSession(Session session, SessionFactory sessionFactory) {
    if (session != null && session.isOpen() && session.isConnected() && session.getFlushMode() != FlushMode.NEVER) {
        try {
            session.flush();
        } catch (Exception e) {
            log.error("Unable to flush Hibernate session. Possible data loss: " + e.getMessage(), e);
        } finally {
            super.closeSession(session, sessionFactory);
        }
    }
}



{code}
Unable to reproduce at this time.
h3. Expected Results

Logs have no error.
h3. Actual Results

Logs throw
{code:java}
2016-07-31 09:09:21,804 ERROR [http-nio-80-exec-21] [atlassian.spring.filter.FlushingSpringSessionInViewFilter] closeSession Unable to flush Hibernate session. Possible data loss: ClobStringType requires active transaction synchronization
 -- traceId: f5a84584a0aace71
java.lang.IllegalStateException: ClobStringType requires active transaction synchronization
    at com.atlassian.hibernate.BucketClobStringType.nullSafeSet(BucketClobStringType.java:118)
    at net.sf.hibernate.type.CustomType.nullSafeSet(CustomType.java:118)
    at net.sf.hibernate.persister.EntityPersister.dehydrate(EntityPersister.java:387)
    at net.sf.hibernate.persister.EntityPersister.update(EntityPersister.java:651)
    at net.sf.hibernate.persister.EntityPersister.update(EntityPersister.java:630)
    at net.sf.hibernate.impl.ScheduledUpdate.execute(ScheduledUpdate.java:52)
    at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.execute(SessionImpl.java:2476)
    at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.executeAll(SessionImpl.java:2462)
    at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.execute(SessionImpl.java:2420)
    at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.flush(SessionImpl.java:2288)
    at com.atlassian.spring.filter.FlushingSpringSessionInViewFilter.closeSession(FlushingSpringSessionInViewFilter.java:46)
...
    at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.vcache.VCacheRequestContextManager.doInRequestContext(VCacheRequestContextManager.java:82)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.vcache.VCacheRequestContextManager.doInRequestContext(VCacheRequestContextManager.java:72)
...
    at org.apache.coyote.http11.AbstractHttp11Processor.process(AbstractHttp11Processor.java:1095)
    at org.apache.coyote.AbstractProtocol$AbstractConnectionHandler.process(AbstractProtocol.java:672)
    at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$SocketProcessor.doRun(NioEndpoint.java:1502)
    at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$SocketProcessor.run(NioEndpoint.java:1458)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
    at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)




{code}
h3. Notes

There are quite a few tickets from Confluence 1.0 days that have this same error. It is unlikely to be a regression.

It may be based on a timeout issue. Usually occurs when returning to the Dashboard, which is why is occurs often with CONF-43246.
h3. Workaround

There is no Workaround.
h3. More Information Required

To further troubleshoot this we need to be able to reproduce it. To figure out how to do that, we would like to look at instances which have access logging enabled, to try and establish usage patterns that immediately precede this error. So far we have seen login and dashboard requests immediately preceding, but we don't have enough data for this to be statistically significant, given that these are two extremely common actions.

If you are experiencing this error and would be able to work with us to troubleshoot it, please raise a [Support Request|https://support.atlassian.com/].
fields.summary: Confluence throws java.lang.IllegalStateException: ClobStringType requires active transaction synchronization

h3. Notes

This issue does not usually occur with Chrome.

Here is the list of the special characters:
{code}
";", "?", "/", "#", "%", "+", "|", "[", "]", "\"
{code}

h3. Workaround

There are a couple of ways to change this.

h6. Changes in reverse proxy

Follow this guide: [Pages with special characters are not accessible via reverse proxy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/pages-with-special-characters-are-not-accessible-via-reverse-proxy-829664257.html].

h6. Changes in Confluence

 # Use Chrome to access the page
 # Remove the special character from the title of the page
 #* Run this SQL query (adjust the title section for the relevant invalid character)
{code:java}
select contentid, contenttype, title, lowertitle, lastmoddate from content where contenttype = 'PAGE' and prevver is NULL and (title like '%[%' or title like '%]%') order by lastmoddate;
{code}
 # For each {{contentid}} edit the page with
 #* [http://confluence.mycompany.com/pages/editpage.action?pageId=]<contentid>

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43533].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If a Page Property Report is nested within an Expand Macro on a Confluence Page, the Top Row of the Report does not appear to load or sort correctly

h3. Environment
* Confluence 1000.245.0 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start with a JIRA + Confluence Cloud instance.
# In Confluence, create a page with a Page Properties Report macro on it.
# Create another page with the Page Properties macro in it that'll show in the Page Properties Report macro above.
# Insert a table into the Page Properties macro that contains a JIRA Issues Macro that shows a Single JIRA Issue
# View the original page with the Page Properties Report on it.

h3. Expected Results
Page Property Report shows Details of JIRA Issue 
If multiple Pages are included on this Report, Columns can be sorted.

h3. Actual Results
No Errors are generated in the Logs or in the Browser Debug Console.
If a JIRA Issue Macro is used, it will show a Spinner Loading Icon with the message "Getting Issue Details..." 
!PagePropertyReport-inExpand.png|thumbnail! 

If you try to sort by Column by clicking the Column's Title, the sort does not affect the top line
!SortByTitle-Desc.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Even if a JIRA Issue Macro is not a part of the nested Page Property Report, the Columns cannot be sorted. !PagePropertyReport-NoJIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Move the Page Property Report outside of the Expand Macro
fields.summary: Loading Issue With Page Properties Report and Nested Macros
Add ability to modify search limit for attachment files

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43530].
  {panel}

Dear Confluence developers,

at our foundation we really like the daily update mail.

Currently this daily update mail provides a link to the changes. But this link only shows the difference to the most recent version. Inconvenience: If a colleague makes major changes to the document, clicks save and then finds (and corrects) a little spelling error, then the link in the daily update mail will only show the change to the spelling error. Hence all other colleagues might miss that there was a major change.

My feature request:
Could you change the daily update mail so that the "changes"-link compares the current version to the version that was current at the end of the previous day?

It's probably a small change with which you could make many customers happy, because there's no longer a risk to miss out on important changes.

Thanks in advance and greetings from Berlin
Dirk
fields.summary: Change links in daily change mail should compare to previous day

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43521].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

In JIRA, when displaying the Burndown Chart, you are able to click a drop down to change the 'estimation statistic' used in the axis of the chart. When the gadget is embedded in Confluence, the axis used is based on the configured estimation statistic for the board, but it's not possible to switch views in the embedded Confluence gadget. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Add a drop-down list in the Confluence gadget that allows switching between the estimation statistics (story points, original time estimate, issue count).
fields.summary: Allow switching between estimation statistics when embedding the JIRA Sprint Burndown Chart in Confluence

fields.description:
While merging changes will concurrent editing feature, both users are editing the same page.

h5. Scenario
{{User A}} and {{User B}} are editing the same page.

{{User A}} save first and {{User B}} save later.

h5. Expected Behavior
{{User B}} should receive a warning stating that {{User A}} had save the page, should you overwrite the changes.

h5. Actual Behavior
The warning message is showing the {{User B}} had made the changes, instead of {{User A}}.

h5. Screenshot
 !Screen Shot 2016-08-24 at 11.41.12 PM.png|thumbnail! 
User {{jo}} is currently logged in and editing a page. Somebody save the page before user {{jo}}.
While user {{jo}} save the page, the warning message shows that {{jo}} had made the changes, which is incorrect.

h5. Tested with
Two different machines with the using same or different browser (Chrome and Firefox)
fields.summary: Concurrent Editing and Merging Changes Doesn't Refer to the Correct User
